intro: Hieracium valdepilosum subsp. valdepilosum, commonly known as the Valdepiños hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, hairy leaves and produces yellow composite flowers. The species is native to southern Europe and is often found in grassy habitats. It is a perennial herb that thrives in sunny, well-drained soils. The plant is notable for its distinctive leaf morphology and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
